MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

Visitpaxos.com/careersto explore our open roles#LifeAtPaxos

overall_prompt_summary: The provided context emphasizes the cryptocurrency ecosystem's focus on technological advancements, governance, market development, and community engagement. It lacks real-time data on social media influencers and engagement in the crypto space. The most critical issues highlighted are the absence of real-time analytics for identifying key influencers and the inability to analyze posts for bot-like behavior. There is also a mention of the unlikelihood of manipulation schemes due to the absence of invite links and the legitimate nature of the updates. A potential improvement would be to integrate access to real-time social media analytics and post-analysis capabilities for more accurate assessments.

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

Paxos is now a multi-chain#stablecoinissuer! Our regulated digital dollar USDP will soon be available on the Solana blockchain. Solana's high-performance network and low fees align with Paxos' vision for a more open and efficient financial future 🚀

According to Paxos Head of StrategyWalter Hessert, "We're making it easier for anyone to get and use the safest, most reliable stablecoins."

Learn more:https://bit.ly/47a0uco

Today's enterprises recognize the potential opportunities in building with#blockchain— as shown in a recent survey where 99% of financial services companies said they are pursuing#blockchainsolutions to enhance the customer experience and develop internal efficiencies. At Paxos, we guide some of the world's largest financial companies in developing strategies to implement this pioneering technology.

Get this information and other insights from our 2023 Enterprise Adoption Survey Report now:https://bit.ly/473Z0Al

Blockchain development can seem daunting, but it doesn't have to be. That's why our Engineering team is launching a new series called Blockchain 101.

In our first installment, we explore the foundational math and underlying principles behind#blockchaintechnology.

Learn more here:https://bit.ly/3RRCHK4

In our latest webinar,PayPal'sPaul Bancesand Paxos'Nicholas Robnettexplored the rise of#stablecoins, the expansion of#PYUSDand more withRebecca McClain, Director of Communications at Paxos. Watch the replay:https://bit.ly/4abqo25

📍 Singapore
🎟 Holiday party

Our Singapore team got together to celebrate their wins this year, with good food, good company and even some swag ✨ 

Want to join them in 2024? Apply to our Product Operations Associate role based in 🇸🇬:https://bit.ly/41vrodF

99% of US financial services companies recently surveyed by Paxos said they pursued digital asset or#blockchainsolutions in 2023, signaling the industry may weather the crypto winter as enterprise interest in increasing customer offerings is a key driver!

Read more here:https://bit.ly/3RKhP6j

Our Developer Infrastructure team builds reliable and scalable tooling that supports a world-class developer experience at Paxos. Hear from Director of Engineering,W. Tyler Gass, about what excites him most about the work 👇

Paxos General CounselBen Grayhas been instrumental in guiding us through pivotal launches and ensuring that regulation and compliance remain our cornerstone.

We asked Ben five important questions about how he and his team are navigating our rapidly-evolving industry. Don't miss his responses:https://bit.ly/3NrtENn

Last week,PayPal'sPaul Bancesand Paxos'Nicholas Robnettsat down withRebecca McClain, Director of Communications at Paxos for a deep dive into this new era of regulated#stablecoins, the emergence of PayPal USD and more. 

Access the webinar replay here:https://bit.ly/4abqo25
Last week, our Engineering Summit was nothing short of amazing. From inspiring talks to an energizing hackathon, we did it all. Check out all of the best moments here 👇

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

Visitpaxos.com/careersto explore our open roles #LifeAtPaxos

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

Paxos: You do you 💻 😎

Our remote-first way of working means you can help open the world’s financial system to everyone from anywhere 🌎

Where will you join us from?paxos.com/careers#LifeAtPaxos

Issued by Paxos 💫 

Congratulations toPayPalandSolana Foundationon the big launch! 1,376,759 followers Today, we unveiled that PayPal USD (PYUSD) is now available on the Solana blockchain. 

Solana is the second blockchain that supports PYUSD, after Ethereum, and is known for processing vast amounts of transactions at high speeds with extremely low costs, providing significant benefits for commerce use cases. These integrations allow U.S. consumers to connect their PayPal accounts to provide a seamless fiat-to-crypto experience. 

Learn more:https://bit.ly/3WYOvwU

Breaking News:PayPalUSD, a stablecoin issued byPaxos, is now live on Solana! 

We're excited to announce that PayPal has launched the PYUSD stablecoin on the Solana blockchain, leveraging the power of token extensions. 

✉️PayPal released a letter showcasing how Solana's low costs, close to instant settlement, high throughput, and advanced token extensions functionality make it an ideal network for issuing PYUSD:https://lnkd.in/g7uBEKDF🪙Token extensions enable technology companies like PayPal to issue permissioned tokens on Solana's permissionless network easily out-of-the-box, showcasing the growing trend of institutions choosing Solana for stablecoins, RWAs, and more:solana.com/tokenextensions👩💻 Developers can start integrating PYUSD support into their dApps today:https://lnkd.in/gEBs48mwRead more fromCoinDesk:https://lnkd.in/gCgeGEzN

ICYMI:PayPalUSD is now live on Solana 🥳 Learn more about what the expansion toSolana Foundationenables for PYUSD fromJose Fernandez da Ponte, SVP, Blockchain, Crypto & Digital Currencies, PayPal and the team atBloombergCrypto 👇bloom.bg/3R4otVp

BIG news from#Consensus2024:PayPalUSD is now available on Solana 🎉

The availability of PYUSD on Solana makes it faster and cheaper to use, giving users more flexibility and control over PayPal’s multi-chain stablecoin. You can get started with PYUSD on Solana right now through PayPal,Venmo, Paxos,Crypto.comorPhantom.

To learn more about this exciting new chapter for PYUSD, read on:bit.ly/3wTQOqtSolana Foundation|https://lnkd.in/eK8kHqDN

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

Visitpaxos.com/careersto explore our open roles#LifeAtPaxos

overall_prompt_summary:
The posts are automated, focusing on stablecoins, payment solutions, educational initiatives, and regulatory compliance. They lack manipulation tactics and emphasize legitimate business growth through partnerships and listings.

The most important issues are the repetitive structure and frequent use of hashtags, which indicate bot-generated content. Additionally, the posts lack personal engagement and do not promote rapid price increases or guaranteed returns.

A potential improvement would be to incorporate more personalized and engaging content to enhance authenticity and user interaction.

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

Visitpaxos.com/careersto explore our open roles#LifeAtPaxos

overall_prompt_summary: The posts exhibit characteristics of bot-generated content, such as repetitive promotional language, lack of personal touches, and multiple links. They focus on partnerships, compliance, and educational initiatives without evidence of manipulation schemes. The most important issues are the repetitive and impersonal nature of the content, which suggests potential automation, and the absence of misleading hype or false promises. While the posts do not contain invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, their promotional tone could still be improved. To enhance the content, adding personal touches and reducing repetitive language would make it more engaging and authentic.

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

Paxosreposted this CEO and Co-Founder at Paxos When we started Paxos, we knew institutional blockchain adoption would not happen overnight. Financial markets are complex and highly regulated. Our thesis has always been that institutional adoption of blockchain and stablecoins presents enormous benefits for billions of people around the world, but these products, services and companies must be overseen by prudential regulatory authorities. That’s the only way to ensure consumer safety and security. That is why we established Paxos and our products under prudential regulatory supervision. 

The recent piece from the Bloomberg Editorial Board calls to light why stablecoins should be issued by regulated entities. We agree - which is why Paxos and its products are regulated by prudential regulators like the New York Department of Financial Services, the Monetary Authority of Singapore and the Financial Services Regulatory Authority of Abu Dhabi Global Market. Unregulated leaders in the space like Tether and Circle pose significant risks to investors, financial markets and national security–something each has shown multiple times. Without oversight, you cannot maintain trust. “Trust, but verify,” is an adage everyone should follow, just like Paxos. 

We recognize the pivotal role that regulatory clarity plays in shaping the future of the crypto industry, which is why we have actively sought consistent standards of regulation and advocated for state pathways. I’m glad to see some momentum with the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century (FIT 21) bill, but now that we’ve started the ball rolling, it’s time to pick up the pace. Delays in providing clear regulatory frameworks are stifling innovation and market growth and forcing firms like Paxos to invest overseas. That only puts the United States at risk of falling behind in the industry that will determine the future of the global financial system.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

Visitpaxos.com/careersto explore our open roles#LifeAtPaxos

prompts_output.Prompt: Analyze these posts to determine if any show characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts show characteristics of bot-generated content, such as lack of personal engagement, promotional focus, uniformity, and multiple links, suggesting automation rather than human authorship.

prompts_output.Prompt: Examine these posts for the presence of invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, and assess their potential role in manipulation schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts do not contain invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups. They focus on updates about Tether's activities, partnerships, and job openings, with no signs of manipulation schemes like pump-and-dump or Ponzi tactics.

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts based on their content and topics, focusing on how they relate to cryptocurrency market trends and investor behavior. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts focus on technological advancements, partnerships, and compliance in the cryptocurrency market. They reflect investor priorities like security, regulatory compliance, and sustainability, without manipulation tactics. The content suggests automated generation, emphasizing updates and promotional information.

overall_prompt_summary: The posts focus on partnerships, technological advancements, and compliance, avoiding aggressive price promotion and unrealistic profit promises. They exhibit characteristics of bot-generated content, such as lack of personal engagement and uniformity. The most important issues are the promotional focus and automation, which suggest a lack of human authorship. Additionally, the posts include multiple links and lack personal engagement, further indicating bot activity. To improve, incorporating more personal engagement and reducing automation would enhance authenticity.

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

Paxosreposted this CEO and Co-Founder at Paxos When we started Paxos, we knew institutional blockchain adoption would not happen overnight. Financial markets are complex and highly regulated. Our thesis has always been that institutional adoption of blockchain and stablecoins presents enormous benefits for billions of people around the world, but these products, services and companies must be overseen by prudential regulatory authorities. That’s the only way to ensure consumer safety and security. That is why we established Paxos and our products under prudential regulatory supervision. 

The recent piece from the Bloomberg Editorial Board calls to light why stablecoins should be issued by regulated entities. We agree - which is why Paxos and its products are regulated by prudential regulators like the New York Department of Financial Services, the Monetary Authority of Singapore and the Financial Services Regulatory Authority of Abu Dhabi Global Market. Unregulated leaders in the space like Tether and Circle pose significant risks to investors, financial markets and national security–something each has shown multiple times. Without oversight, you cannot maintain trust. “Trust, but verify,” is an adage everyone should follow, just like Paxos. 

We recognize the pivotal role that regulatory clarity plays in shaping the future of the crypto industry, which is why we have actively sought consistent standards of regulation and advocated for state pathways. I’m glad to see some momentum with the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century (FIT 21) bill, but now that we’ve started the ball rolling, it’s time to pick up the pace. Delays in providing clear regulatory frameworks are stifling innovation and market growth and forcing firms like Paxos to invest overseas. That only puts the United States at risk of falling behind in the industry that will determine the future of the global financial system.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

Visitpaxos.com/careersto explore our open roles#LifeAtPaxos

They reflect trends in blockchain education, green energy, low transaction costs, and secure digital assets, aligning with investor priorities and legitimate business strategies.

overall_prompt_summary:
The posts exhibit characteristics of bot-generated content, such as lack of personal engagement, repetitive promotional language, and multiple links, but focus on legitimate business strategies. Without more context, it is inconclusive whether they are deceptive or not.

The most important issues are the lack of personal engagement and the repetitive promotional language, which are common in bot-generated content. Additionally, the presence of multiple links further suggests automated generation. 

To improve, adding more personalized and varied content could help distinguish these posts from bot-generated material.

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

Paxosreposted this CEO and Co-Founder at Paxos When we started Paxos, we knew institutional blockchain adoption would not happen overnight. Financial markets are complex and highly regulated. Our thesis has always been that institutional adoption of blockchain and stablecoins presents enormous benefits for billions of people around the world, but these products, services and companies must be overseen by prudential regulatory authorities. That’s the only way to ensure consumer safety and security. That is why we established Paxos and our products under prudential regulatory supervision. 

The recent piece from the Bloomberg Editorial Board calls to light why stablecoins should be issued by regulated entities. We agree - which is why Paxos and its products are regulated by prudential regulators like the New York Department of Financial Services, the Monetary Authority of Singapore and the Financial Services Regulatory Authority of Abu Dhabi Global Market. Unregulated leaders in the space like Tether and Circle pose significant risks to investors, financial markets and national security–something each has shown multiple times. Without oversight, you cannot maintain trust. “Trust, but verify,” is an adage everyone should follow, just like Paxos. 

We recognize the pivotal role that regulatory clarity plays in shaping the future of the crypto industry, which is why we have actively sought consistent standards of regulation and advocated for state pathways. I’m glad to see some momentum with the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century (FIT 21) bill, but now that we’ve started the ball rolling, it’s time to pick up the pace. Delays in providing clear regulatory frameworks are stifling innovation and market growth and forcing firms like Paxos to invest overseas. That only puts the United States at risk of falling behind in the industry that will determine the future of the global financial system.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

Visitpaxos.com/careersto explore our open roles#LifeAtPaxos

overall_prompt_summary:
The posts appear to be generated by bots or automated accounts, focusing on partnerships, technology, and education without signs of manipulation schemes. They lack personal engagement, use repetitive promotional language, and include multiple links.

The most important issues are the lack of personal engagement and the repetitive, uniform focus on specific topics, which suggest automation. Additionally, the posts do not contain aggressive price promotions or recruitment incentives, indicating they are not part of manipulation schemes.

To improve, incorporating more personal engagement and varied content could make the posts appear more authentic and less automated.

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

Paxosreposted this CEO and Co-Founder at Paxos When we started Paxos, we knew institutional blockchain adoption would not happen overnight. Financial markets are complex and highly regulated. Our thesis has always been that institutional adoption of blockchain and stablecoins presents enormous benefits for billions of people around the world, but these products, services and companies must be overseen by prudential regulatory authorities. That’s the only way to ensure consumer safety and security. That is why we established Paxos and our products under prudential regulatory supervision. 

The recent piece from the Bloomberg Editorial Board calls to light why stablecoins should be issued by regulated entities. We agree - which is why Paxos and its products are regulated by prudential regulators like the New York Department of Financial Services, the Monetary Authority of Singapore and the Financial Services Regulatory Authority of Abu Dhabi Global Market. Unregulated leaders in the space like Tether and Circle pose significant risks to investors, financial markets and national security–something each has shown multiple times. Without oversight, you cannot maintain trust. “Trust, but verify,” is an adage everyone should follow, just like Paxos. 

We recognize the pivotal role that regulatory clarity plays in shaping the future of the crypto industry, which is why we have actively sought consistent standards of regulation and advocated for state pathways. I’m glad to see some momentum with the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century (FIT 21) bill, but now that we’ve started the ball rolling, it’s time to pick up the pace. Delays in providing clear regulatory frameworks are stifling innovation and market growth and forcing firms like Paxos to invest overseas. That only puts the United States at risk of falling behind in the industry that will determine the future of the global financial system.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

Visitpaxos.com/careersto explore our open roles#LifeAtPaxos

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts into different themes related to cryptocurrency (e.g., regulation, technological advancements, market predictions). Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output:
The posts can be categorized into:

1. **Regulation**: Compliance and regulatory alignment.
2. **Technological Advancements**: Product launches, AI solutions, Keet's transition.
3. **Education**: University and organizational initiatives.
4. **Sustainability**: Green energy in mining.
5. **Market Trends**: Blockchain resilience, investor interests.

prompts_output.Prompt: Assess these posts for insights into investor behavior, concerns, and expectations regarding cryptocurrencies. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Investors prioritize stability, regulatory compliance, and sustainability, valuing educational initiatives and technological development. They avoid aggressive promotions and unrealistic profit promises, seeking reliable, transparent market practices and innovation in the cryptocurrency space.

prompts_output.Prompt: Spot any emerging trends in topics discussed in these posts about the company. Are there any new developments, controversies, or milestones that are garnering attention? Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Emerging trends include regulatory compliance, green energy in mining, and educational initiatives. The focus is on stability, sustainability, and technological advancements, with no evident controversies.

prompts_output.Prompt: Identify any patterns or strategies in these posts that resemble known cryptocurrency manipulation tactics such as pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack patterns of cryptocurrency manipulation tactics like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes; they focus on stability, regulatory compliance, and technological development without aggressive price promotion or unrealistic profit promises.

prompts_output.Prompt: Analyze these posts to determine if any show characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts exhibit a promotional tone, repetitive calls to action, and lack personal engagement or context-specific details, all of which suggest they could be generated by bots or automated accounts.

prompts_output.Prompt: Examine these posts for the presence of invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, and assess their potential role in manipulation schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups and focus on Tether's collaborations, compliance, and educational initiatives, with no signs of manipulation schemes like aggressive price promotion or unrealistic profit promises.

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts based on their content and topics, focusing on how they relate to cryptocurrency market trends and investor behavior. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts can be categorized into **Regulation**, **Technological Advancements**, **Education**, **Sustainability**, and **Market Trends**. They emphasize stability, regulatory compliance, green energy, and innovation, aligning with investor preferences for sustainable and secure investments in the cryptocurrency space.

overall_prompt_summary:
The posts emphasize stability, regulatory compliance, and technological advancements, focusing on partnerships and educational initiatives without aggressive price promotion or unrealistic profit promises. They exhibit a promotional tone with repetitive calls to action, suggesting possible automated content generation.

The most important issues are the lack of personal engagement and context-specific details, as well as the potential use of bots or automated accounts to generate content. Additionally, the posts lack the hallmarks of cryptocurrency manipulation tactics like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes.

To improve, incorporating more personalized and context-specific content could enhance engagement and authenticity.

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

Today, Paxos International announced the launch of Lift Dollar (#USDL) – a yield-bearing stablecoin with regulatory oversight that democratizes access to US dollars and safe yield generated from cash and cash equivalent assets. Now, you can seamlessly spend, save and trade, all while earning yield. 

USDL is issued by Paxos International, a regulated entity overseen by the Financial Services Regulatory Authority in theADGM, ensuring the highest standards of consumer protection. Note: USDL is not available to residents of the US, UK, EU, UAE, Canada, Japan, Hong Kong, Singapore and other specific countries.

Paxosreposted this CEO and Co-Founder at Paxos When we started Paxos, we knew institutional blockchain adoption would not happen overnight. Financial markets are complex and highly regulated. Our thesis has always been that institutional adoption of blockchain and stablecoins presents enormous benefits for billions of people around the world, but these products, services and companies must be overseen by prudential regulatory authorities. That’s the only way to ensure consumer safety and security. That is why we established Paxos and our products under prudential regulatory supervision. 

The recent piece from the Bloomberg Editorial Board calls to light why stablecoins should be issued by regulated entities. We agree - which is why Paxos and its products are regulated by prudential regulators like the New York Department of Financial Services, the Monetary Authority of Singapore and the Financial Services Regulatory Authority of Abu Dhabi Global Market. Unregulated leaders in the space like Tether and Circle pose significant risks to investors, financial markets and national security–something each has shown multiple times. Without oversight, you cannot maintain trust. “Trust, but verify,” is an adage everyone should follow, just like Paxos. 

We recognize the pivotal role that regulatory clarity plays in shaping the future of the crypto industry, which is why we have actively sought consistent standards of regulation and advocated for state pathways. I’m glad to see some momentum with the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century (FIT 21) bill, but now that we’ve started the ball rolling, it’s time to pick up the pace. Delays in providing clear regulatory frameworks are stifling innovation and market growth and forcing firms like Paxos to invest overseas. That only puts the United States at risk of falling behind in the industry that will determine the future of the global financial system.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

prompts_output.Prompt: Identify any patterns or strategies in these posts that resemble known cryptocurrency manipulation tactics such as pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack patterns typical of manipulation tactics like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes, focusing instead on partnerships, technological advancements, and educational initiatives without misleading hype or high return promises.

prompts_output.Prompt: Analyze these posts to determine if any show characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts exhibit a promotional tone, lack personal engagement, and include multiple links, which are characteristics often associated with bot-generated content. However, without more context, it's not definitive.

prompts_output.Prompt: Examine these posts for the presence of invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, and assess their potential role in manipulation schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups and primarily share informational updates on Tether's activities, focusing on legitimacy and stability without evident manipulation schemes.

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts based on their content and topics, focusing on how they relate to cryptocurrency market trends and investor behavior. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts fall into **Adoption and Integration**, **Financial Performance**, and **Emerging Trends**, emphasizing Tether's platform expansions, financial transparency, and technological advancements, aligning with investor interests in blockchain resilience, compliance, and innovation.

overall_prompt_summary:
The posts focus on promoting legitimacy and stability through partnerships, technological advancements, and educational initiatives, without showing signs of pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. They exhibit a promotional tone, lack personal engagement, and include multiple links, which are characteristics often associated with bot-generated content.

The most important issues are the lack of personal engagement and the promotional tone, which could make the content seem less trustworthy. Additionally, the presence of multiple links can be a red flag for bot-generated content. 

To improve, adding more personal engagement and reducing the number of links could enhance the authenticity and trustworthiness of the posts.

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

Paxosreposted this CEO and Co-Founder at Paxos When we started Paxos, we knew institutional blockchain adoption would not happen overnight. Financial markets are complex and highly regulated. Our thesis has always been that institutional adoption of blockchain and stablecoins presents enormous benefits for billions of people around the world, but these products, services and companies must be overseen by prudential regulatory authorities. That’s the only way to ensure consumer safety and security. That is why we established Paxos and our products under prudential regulatory supervision. 

The recent piece from the Bloomberg Editorial Board calls to light why stablecoins should be issued by regulated entities. We agree - which is why Paxos and its products are regulated by prudential regulators like the New York Department of Financial Services, the Monetary Authority of Singapore and the Financial Services Regulatory Authority of Abu Dhabi Global Market. Unregulated leaders in the space like Tether and Circle pose significant risks to investors, financial markets and national security–something each has shown multiple times. Without oversight, you cannot maintain trust. “Trust, but verify,” is an adage everyone should follow, just like Paxos. 

We recognize the pivotal role that regulatory clarity plays in shaping the future of the crypto industry, which is why we have actively sought consistent standards of regulation and advocated for state pathways. I’m glad to see some momentum with the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century (FIT 21) bill, but now that we’ve started the ball rolling, it’s time to pick up the pace. Delays in providing clear regulatory frameworks are stifling innovation and market growth and forcing firms like Paxos to invest overseas. That only puts the United States at risk of falling behind in the industry that will determine the future of the global financial system.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts into different themes related to cryptocurrency (e.g., regulation, technological advancements, market predictions). Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts can be categorized into **Technological Advancements**, **Market Expansion**, **Regulation and Compliance**, and **Partnerships and Collaborations**. These themes reflect investor interests in blockchain resilience, sustainable mining, financial inclusion, and compliance, driving cryptocurrency adoption and trust.

prompts_output.Prompt: Assess these posts for insights into investor behavior, concerns, and expectations regarding cryptocurrencies. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Investors prioritize blockchain resilience, renewable energy in mining, financial inclusion, and compliance. They expect robust security, sustainable practices, and educational initiatives to drive cryptocurrency adoption and trust, focusing on technological advancements, market expansion, regulation, and partnerships.

prompts_output.Prompt: Spot any emerging trends in topics discussed in these posts about the company. Are there any new developments, controversies, or milestones that are garnering attention? Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: Emerging trends include technological advancements like USD₮ on TON, green energy mining, market expansion, and a focus on regulation and compliance. Notable milestones are collaborations and investments, with no controversies noted, highlighting transparency and sustainability efforts.

prompts_output.Prompt: Identify any patterns or strategies in these posts that resemble known cryptocurrency manipulation tactics such as pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack patterns typical of manipulation tactics like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes, focusing instead on transparency, compliance, and legitimate partnerships without misleading elements or invite links.

prompts_output.Prompt: Analyze these posts to determine if any show characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts show characteristics of being generated by bots or automated accounts due to their lack of personal engagement, repetitive promotional content, and inclusion of multiple links.

prompts_output.Prompt: Examine these posts for the presence of invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, and assess their potential role in manipulation schemes. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts lack invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups, focusing instead on partnerships, platform integrations, and compliance. This suggests they aim for genuine engagement rather than participating in manipulation schemes.

prompts_output.Prompt: Categorize these posts based on their content and topics, focusing on how they relate to cryptocurrency market trends and investor behavior. Provide your explanation in less than 50 words.
prompts_output.Output: The posts can be categorized into **Technological Advancements**, **Market Expansion**, **Regulation and Compliance**, and **Partnerships and Collaborations**. These categories align with investor interests in blockchain resilience, sustainable mining, financial inclusion, and compliance, driving cryptocurrency adoption and trust.

overall_prompt_summary:
The posts emphasize transparency, compliance, and legitimate partnerships, avoiding misleading elements typical of manipulation tactics like pump-and-dump or Ponzi schemes. They focus on positive news, technological advancements, and market expansion, highlighting transparency and sustainability efforts.

The posts show characteristics of being generated by bots due to their lack of personal engagement, repetitive promotional content, and inclusion of multiple links. Despite creating hype and driving demand, they lack personal engagement and contain repetitive content.

To improve, incorporating more personal engagement and reducing repetitive content could enhance authenticity and user trust.

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.

Paxosreposted this CEO and Co-Founder at Paxos When we started Paxos, we knew institutional blockchain adoption would not happen overnight. Financial markets are complex and highly regulated. Our thesis has always been that institutional adoption of blockchain and stablecoins presents enormous benefits for billions of people around the world, but these products, services and companies must be overseen by prudential regulatory authorities. That’s the only way to ensure consumer safety and security. That is why we established Paxos and our products under prudential regulatory supervision. 

The recent piece from the Bloomberg Editorial Board calls to light why stablecoins should be issued by regulated entities. We agree - which is why Paxos and its products are regulated by prudential regulators like the New York Department of Financial Services, the Monetary Authority of Singapore and the Financial Services Regulatory Authority of Abu Dhabi Global Market. Unregulated leaders in the space like Tether and Circle pose significant risks to investors, financial markets and national security–something each has shown multiple times. Without oversight, you cannot maintain trust. “Trust, but verify,” is an adage everyone should follow, just like Paxos. 

We recognize the pivotal role that regulatory clarity plays in shaping the future of the crypto industry, which is why we have actively sought consistent standards of regulation and advocated for state pathways. I’m glad to see some momentum with the Financial Innovation and Technology for the 21st Century (FIT 21) bill, but now that we’ve started the ball rolling, it’s time to pick up the pace. Delays in providing clear regulatory frameworks are stifling innovation and market growth and forcing firms like Paxos to invest overseas. That only puts the United States at risk of falling behind in the industry that will determine the future of the global financial system.

MeetAn Dinh, a Software Engineer on the Blockchain Core team at Paxos. An and her team provide and maintain internal APIs for Paxos, as well as build out infrastructures to support workflows for different chains, such as transfers, withdrawals and deposits. Hear from An about why blockchain development was a fit for her:

"My parents work in the finance industry, and one of the pain points for them is always the very, very slow speed of moving assets around," said An. "At Paxos, I feel like I can help be a part of the shift to invigorate and improve on the current financial system, and that makes me very excited."

She also described some of the unique challenges of being a blockchain developer:

"We work with different chains all the time, so there are always new challenges every single day. You're never seeing two blockchains that are exactly the same, as some have benefits on one side and some have benefits on the other. It's always really nice to be able to do the research and readings into the blockchains to make informed decisions based on the data you've collected."

As for tips to anyone looking to break into blockchain development, here’s what An had to say:

"First off, I would recommend reading up on the blockchain that you're interested in. It’s important to get in the habit of staying on top of the latest research, as blockchain technologies are ever-growing and ever-changing. Next, set up a local chain. Many blockchains are open-source and have very quick guides of how to get started in their development, so playing around with a local chain in your own time can really help you get familiar with it."

And finally, the most fun thing about working at Paxos?

"It's fun working at Paxos because my team is amazing. We lean on each other, support each other and cover for each other in times of need. I'm working with some amazing engineers here who teach me a lot about development, deployments and how to make our system more secure to protect the assets of our customers. That is something that I've never experienced anywhere else, and I am really grateful to be able to learn that here at Paxos."

overall_prompt_summary: The posts exhibit characteristics of bot-generated content, such as repetitive call-to-action phrases and multiple links, but lack definitive evidence. They emphasize transparency, compliance, and legitimate business strategies without manipulative tactics or suspicious links. The most important issues are the repetitive nature of the content and the presence of multiple links, which are common in bot-generated posts. However, the posts do not contain invite links to cryptocurrency channels or groups and focus on legitimate business strategies. Potential improvement could involve reducing repetitive phrases and ensuring more varied and engaging content.

profile_overview: Paxos is a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions.
profile_bio:
Paxos is building the foundation for the open financial system. We are a regulated blockchain infrastructure company building transparent and transformative financial solutions. We create accessible blockchain infrastructure that’s instantaneous and reliable, 24/7 - whether it’s enabling crypto features for enterprises, launching the world’s first fully-regulated, asset-backed tokens (USDP & PAXG), or setting a new standard of efficiency for settlement of securities.

We empower today’s financial leaders to build a more open, trusted economy. These leaders include PayPal, Mercado Libre, Interactive Brokers and Mastercard.
